notes: Foundations in myths and symbolic views of reasoning, no formal AI field yet.
Reasoning viewed as symbol manipulation; conceptual basis for later AI.
Computers capable of logical operations at high speed, enabling AI experimentation.
Formal launch of AI as a research field; strong optimism among pioneers.
Rule-based systems and logic programs; optimism and growing funding.
Limitations of symbolic approaches become visible; expectations questioned.
Lighthill report and government cuts lead to disillusionment and reduced funding.
Ambitious national program revives global interest in AI and expert systems.
Expert systems deployed in finance, manufacturing, and diagnostics.
High expectations not met; maintenance costs and brittleness drive investors away.
Shift from symbolic systems to data-driven statistical machine learning.
Explosion of data and computing power enables large-scale ML and deep learning.
Deep neural networks achieve state-of-the-art results in vision, speech, and NLP.
Large-scale deployment across sectors: e-commerce, logistics, healthcare, finance.
McKinsey estimates $3.5â€“$5.8T yearly value; generative AI reshapes workflows.
